metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2828 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via WebGL content that triggers texture access after destruction of the texture's recycle pool.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2828` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
